TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContentType extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a MIME protocol Content-Type header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The information in the ContentType class is used to describe the data contained in an e-mail message in such a way that software that displays e-mail can present the content in an appropriate manner. ContentType is used with the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> class to specify the type of content in the attachment.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information about MIME media types and their parameters. These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example sends an e-mail message with an attachment and displays the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.ContentDisposition%2A> properties for the attachment.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#6](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.mime.conten_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.mime.conten_0_1.cs)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.MediaType%2A> property to `"application/octet-stream"`.

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String>, for example, `"text/plain; charset=us-ascii"`, that contains the MIME media type, subtype, and optional parameters.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The syntax of the `contentType` string is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1 available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call this constructor.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.net.mime.conten_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.net.mime.conten_1_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: is in a form that cannot be parsed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the boundary parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the value associated with the boundary parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the Boundary parameter is "`-----boundary---0`".
`content-type: multipart/mixed; boundary=-----boundary---0`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> to remove the boundary information from the header.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. An in-depth discussion of the boundary parameter is contained in RFC 2046 Section 5.1.1. These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the Boundary property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.mime.conten_11_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.mime.conten_11_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the charset parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the value associated with the charset parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the CharSet property is "`us-ascii`".
`content-type: application/x-myType; charset=us-ascii`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> to remove the charset information from the header.
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. An in-depth discussion of the charset parameter is contained in RFC 2046 Section 4.1.2. These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.mime.conten_12_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.mime.conten_12_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Determines whether the content-type header of the specified object is equal to the content-type header of this object.
Docs.returns: if the content-type headers are the same; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines the hash code of the specified object
Gets or sets the media type value included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the media type and subtype value. This value does not include the semicolon (;) separator that follows the subtype.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the MediaType property is `"application/x-myType"`.
`content-type: application/x-myType; name=data.xyz`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> to remove the name information from the header.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information on MIME media types. These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example sets the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.mime.conten_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.mime.conten_1_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The value specified for a set operation is .
The value specified for a set operation is <xref:System.String> ("").
The value specified for a set operation is in a form that cannot be parsed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the name parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the value associated with the name parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the Name property is `"data.xyz"`.
`content-type: application/x-myType; name=data.xyz`
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1, available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
When specifying content for a <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> as a <xref:System.IO.Stream> or <xref:System.String>, you can use Name to set the name of the file that stores the content on the recipient's system.
## Examples The following code example sets the value of the property to specify a name for a file being attached as a stream.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.mime.conten_3_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.mime.conten_3_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the dictionary that contains the parameters included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A writable that contains name and value pairs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set the parameters by specifying the entire Content-Header value when constructing a <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> object or you can add parameters to the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary> returned by the Parameters property.
When adding a parameter entry to the dictionary, the name of the parameter is the entry's key and the value of the parameter is the entry's value.
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information on MIME media types and their associated parameters. These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the values in the dictionary returned by this property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.mime.conten_9_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.mime.conten_9_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> that contains the current settings for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the ToString method contains the string used to create this <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType>, if one was specified and no property values have been changed. If no string was specified, or one or more property values have changed since this <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> was created, the value of ToString is a string in the format of a Content-Type header that is composed using the current property values. The string does not include the `"Content-type:"` prefix.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1, available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the string representation of a <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType>.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.net.mime.conten_4_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclMailSync#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.net.mime.conten_4_1.cs)]
